None of the options provided directly relate to the policy described by Benjamin Franklin in the Examination before Parliament in 1766. The passage discusses the distinction between external and internal taxes and the imposition of the Stamp Act by the British Parliament on the American colonies, which was a significant factor leading to the American Revolution. The options given pertain to different historical contexts involving Native American affairs and do not directly connect to the colonial taxation issues Franklin was addressing.
